medical_history.chief_complaint: Bilateral lower back and abdominal pain.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Pain began moderately the morning of presentation at the level between the lungs and kidneys. It was aggravated by deep inspiration and worsened after eating a sandwich, accompanied by nausea. Symptoms somewhat improved in the morning but worsened again in the evening with addition of dyspnea. The patient took 30mg oxycodone to relieve pain.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Diastolic CHF, poorly controlled IDDM, urinary retention with chronic foley, history of DVT, chronic abdominal wall wound secondary to hernia repair/recurrent infections/SBO, COPD, hypertension, anxiety, depression, chronic pain.
medical_history.family_history: Father died at an unspecified age from an unspecified condition; Mother is alive and well. No other pertinent family history.
medical_history.social_history: Continues to smoke cigarettes approximately 1.5 packs per day; denies any alcohol intake since becoming sober several years ago.
